Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice or Type B kantharos; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (fired reddish); exterior: reserved; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ7
Curator's comments: 'Φ7' is written in pencil on the exterior surface of the sherd. The size of the sherd, the lack of diagnostic elements and the absence of decoration on the interior and exterior surfaces make it impossible to determine whether it came from a kantharos or a chalice. Simple Animal Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. Given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) have very little decoration as well.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1509) (phase 2)
